intro: Corynabutilon ceratocarpum, commonly known as the horned thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to violet flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's unique morphology includes a distinctive, horn-like structure on its fruit, which aids in seed dispersal. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
